section.name: Using Generic Data Types
section.p:
The use of Generics as defined in Java 5 specification never occured to me before receiving an error report by Ted Velkoff with an example that used Generics to specify a test class on on a range datatype.
Astonishing to me it was no big deal to use the code. Actually there is only one thing to keep in mind when specifying Generics data types in xml resource.

Because Generics are implemented in Java by using erasure (Reference to an article by Bruce Eckel) it is neccessary to specify the type of the object in use. The standard mechanism that uses reflection to identify field types does not function here (always returns java.lang.Object).
